Package com.atakmap.android.editableShapes

Class EditablePolyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.FilterMetaDataHolder
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapItem
        • com.atakmap.android.maps.Shape
          • com.atakmap.android.maps.Polyline
            • com.atakmap.android.editableShapes.EditablePolyline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIContent, HashtagContent, Capturable, Exportable, AnchoredMapItem, CenterPointControl, MapItem.OnGroupChangedListener, MapItem.OnZOrderChangedListener, MetaDataHolder, MetaDataHolder2, VisibilityListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DrawingShape, Route, VehicleShape
    public class EditablePolyline
extends Polyline
implements AnchoredMapItem, Exportable, MapItem.OnZOrderChangedListener, CenterPointControl, MapItem.OnGroupChangedListener
    A Polyline that supports modification of it's points via the GUI. Reports touch events complete with which vertex or line the user touched, has the concept of an edit mode, and shows different menus depending on what was touched and if edit mode is active.

    Combined with EditablePolyLineEditTool, EditablePolylineMoveTool, EditablePolyLineReceiver, and a class like ShapeCreationTool or RouteCreationTool, closed shapes and line segments can be input and modified by the user.

    When not being edited and not clickable, performance should be comparable to that of a Polyline.

    Some of the points may also be markers.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  EditablePolyline.ActionProviderInterface
      Outside tools or classes that extend EditablePolyline or interact intimately with it may choose to provide an implementation of this interface if they need to implement their own EditActions, potentially overriding the default behaviors of the built in ones.

        public void moveClosedSet​(GeoPointMetaData oldPoint,
                          GeoPointMetaData newPoint)
        Move a closed EditablePolyline from the previous center point to a new point
        Parameters:
        oldPoint - the old point to act as the center point
        newPoint - the new point to act as the center point, important to shift the entire polygon by a specific amount.

      • addMarker

        public boolean addMarker​(int pointIndex,
                         PointMapItem item)
        Adds a marker to an existing route at a specific index. This method requires that a route be placed on the map already or will be placed on the map in the future.
        Parameters:

        item - the point map item to add.

      • addMarkers

        public boolean addMarkers​(int pointIndex,
                          PointMapItem[] items)
        Bulk insert of waypoints. Much more efficient then the corresponding addMarker. Adds a set marker to an existing route at a specific index. This method requires that a route be placed on the map already or will be placed on the map in the future.
        Parameters:
        pointIndex - the position to add the marker after.
        items - the array of point map items to add.
